intro: Rubus munkacsensis, commonly known as the Munkács raspberry, is a species of bramble native to Hungary. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its thorny stems and aggregate fruits. The plant typically grows in moist, woodland habitats and produces small, red berries in the summer. Its leaves are trifoliate, with serrated edges, and it has a distinctive floral structure with five petals. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
